metadata.Title: CVE-2020-19909 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description: ** DISPUTED ** Integer overflow vulnerability in tool_operate.c in curl 7.65.2 via a large value as the retry delay. NOTE: many parties report that this has no direct security impact on the curl user; however, it may (in theory) cause a denial of service to associated systems or networks if, for example, --retry-delay is misinterpreted as a value much smaller than what was intended. This is not especially plausible because the overflow only happens if the user was trying to specify that curl should wait weeks (or longer) before trying to recover from a transient error.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This CVE is not a security issue, and the curl author intends on disputing this CVE. Marking as not-affected. eslerm> MITRE refused upstream request to reject CVE

criterions.comment: curl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
